ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.2_0: At that time in Rājagaha, there was a group of seventeen boys who were friends
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.3_0: and had the boy Upāli as their leader.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.5_0: “How can Venerable Upāli not live happily without exhausting himself comfort?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.7_0: “If Upāli trains, he’ll train in this way.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.9_0: but then his fingers will hurt.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.10_0: Or he could become a group of monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.12_0: but then his chest will hurt.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.13_0: Or he could become a banker,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.15_0: but then his eyes will hurt.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.16_0: These Sakyan ascetics, however, have pleasant habits and a happy life. After eating nice food, they sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.17_0: If Upāli goes forth with them, he’ll be able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.18_0: Upāli heard this conversation between his parents.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.19_0: He then went to the other boys and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.20_0: “Come, let’s go forth with the Sakyan ascetics.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.21_0: “If you go forth, so will we.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.22_0: Those boys went to their individual parents and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.23_0: “Please allow me to go forth from home to homelessness.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.25_0: Since the parents knew that the boys all had the same desire and good intention, they gave their approval.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.26_0: The boys then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.27_0: And the monks gave them both the going forth and the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.28_0: Soon afterwards they got up early in the morning and cried,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.29_0: “Give us rice porridge, give a meal, give non-staples.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.32_0: If any of those things becomes available, you’ll be able to have it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.33_0: If you eat it, you’ll be able.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.34_0: If you have non-staple food, you’ll eat it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.35_0: But if not, you’ll only be able to eat after walking for alms.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.36_0: But they carried on as before.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.37_0: “Give us rice porridge, give a meal, give non-staples.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.38_0: And they defecated and urinated on the furniture.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.39_0: After rising early in the morning, the Buddha heard the sound of those boys.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.40_0: He asked Venerable Ānanda what was going on,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.43_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.44_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks give the full ordination to people they know are less than twenty years old?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.47_0: “... How can those foolish men do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48_0: A person who is less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And they are unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49_0: But a person who’s twenty years old is able to endure these things.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.51_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.52_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.53.1_0: ‘If a monk gives the full ordination to a person he knows is less than twenty years old, he commits an offense entailing confession. Moreover, that person has not received the full ordination and those monks are blameworthy.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.6_0: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.8_0: those who have not reached twenty years of age.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.9_0: If, intending to give the full ordination, he searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or he establishes a monastic boundary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.10_0: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.11_0: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.12_0: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.13_0: while the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.1_0: If the other person is less than twenty years old, and he perceives them as less, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.2_0: If the other person is less than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.3_0: If the other person is less than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.4_0: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he perceives them as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.5_0: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.6_0: If the other person is more than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.2_0: if he gives the full ordination to someone less than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more than twenty;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.3_0: if he gives the full ordination to a girl more than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more than twenty;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.5_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.6_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on less than twenty years old, is finished.
